meanings.definition: To chart again or make a new chart of.
meanings.sent1: The explorer recharted the island to update the map.
meanings.sent2: She recharted the hiking trail after it was overgrown.
meanings.sent3: The detective recharted the crime scene to find new clues.
meanings.sent4: The scientist recharted the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist recharted her course to find new inspiration.

meanings.definition: To map out or plan again.
meanings.sent1: The team recharted their strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, they had to recharted their route.
meanings.sent3: The students recharted their study schedule for the exam.
meanings.sent4: The architect recharted the building design for better efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The chef recharted the menu to include more variety.

meanings.definition: To record or graph data again.
meanings.sent1: The scientist recharted the experiment results for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The meteorologist recharted the weather patterns for the month.
meanings.sent3: The economist recharted the market trends to analyze them.
meanings.sent4: The teacher recharted the students' progress in the class.
meanings.sent5: The analyst recharted the financial data to create a new report.
